conclusion: Identify conditions for bubble invisibility and determine paper coverage on cube faces.
Cube with side length a, bubble at center, paper on each face for invisibility.
Bubble is equidistant from all cube faces.
Paper must cover bubble from all sides to ensure invisibility.
Viewing angle from outside should not intersect bubble.
Paper on each face must form a sector covering the bubble.
Angle θ for coverage is θ = π/3.
Radius r of coverage circle is r = a/(2√3).
Area S of sector is S = (θπr²)/180.
Substitute values to find S = πa²/24.
Minimum area of each paper piece is πa²/24.
